Package epl341

Class Puzzle

  • java.lang.Object
    • epl341.Puzzle
  • public class Puzzle
extends java.lang.Object
    The Puzzle object represents the actual sliding block puzzle according to the rules given
    Author:
    mbofos01

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Puzzle()
      The default setup we will use is a 7-placed puzzle
      Puzzle​(int size)
      The constructor needs only the size of the puzzle, the tiles are always placed by the same principle

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Puzzle duplicate()
      This method duplicates a puzzle
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)  
      int move​(int from, int to)
      This method moves two tiles only if the move is valid and returns the cost of this move
      int possibleCost​(int from, int to)
      This method calculates the possible cost of a move, if a move is invalid it returns 0
      void print()
      This method prints the puzzle, mostly used for debugginh reasons
      boolean solved()
      This method checks if a state is acceptable For a state to be accepted it has to have all white tiles in places left by black tiles

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Puzzle

        public Puzzle​(int size)
        The constructor needs only the size of the puzzle, the tiles are always placed by the same principle
        Parameters:
        size - An integer bigger than three

      • Puzzle

        public Puzzle()
        The default setup we will use is a 7-placed puzzle

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public int move​(int from,
                int to)
        This method moves two tiles only if the move is valid and returns the cost of this move
        Parameters:
        from - The place of one of the tiles we want to move
        to - The place of the other tile we want to move
        Returns:
        The cost of the move

      • possibleCost

        public int possibleCost​(int from,
                        int to)
        This method calculates the possible cost of a move, if a move is invalid it returns 0
        Parameters:
        from - The place of one of the tiles we want to move
        to - The place of the other tile we want to move
        Returns:
        The cost of the move

      • print

        public void print()
        This method prints the puzzle, mostly used for debugginh reasons

      • solved

        public boolean solved()
        This method checks if a state is acceptable For a state to be accepted it has to have all white tiles in places left by black tiles
        Returns:
        true if the puzzle is solved, otherwise false

      • duplicate

        public Puzzle duplicate()
        This method duplicates a puzzle
        Returns:
        a functional copy of a puzzle

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
